title: Staff Engineer, Validation Engineering
description:
About Marvell
At Marvell, we believe that infrastructure powers progress. That execution is as essential as innovation. That better collaboration builds better technology. Trusted by the world’s leading technology companies for 25 years, we move, store, process and secure the world’s data with semiconductor solutions designed for our customers’ current needs and future ambitions. Through a process of deep collaboration and transparency, we’re ultimately changing the way tomorrow’s enterprise, cloud, automotive, and carrier architectures transform—for the better.

The data infrastructure that our customers build has never been more critical to our global economy. It’s what’s keeping the world connected, businesses running, and information flowing. If you’re ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy your work, apply now for the position detailed below.
The Opportunity
PHY Transceivers
The heart of the connected smart home is its underlying technology including what links all of the components together. Our field-proven microcontrollers and Wi-Fi Microcontroller Internet of Things (IoT) Platform bring high performance and simplicity to enabling a new generation of connected devices ranging from mobile clients and appliances to cloud services and automation.
Job Responsibilities:
Working to verify functionality on Emulation-System of Marvell products.
Research to understand standards and design specifications to build test cases.
Create documents using to test: test plans, test procedure, test methodologies to meet the requirements/standards.
Automation/manual testing using Python/TCL/Bash.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related fields and 3-5 years of related professional experience. Master’s degree and/or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related fields with 2-3 years of experience.
Experienced in Testing Automation/ programming is plus.
Experienced with Python, Bash, TCL, Git, Linux environment.
Knowledge in Verilog and System-verilog is a plus.
Must have effective interpersonal, teamwork, communication skills and active at work.
Have the ability to multi-task.
Have chances to be trained by experts from inside/outside VN.
Have chances to work with new technologies in the world.
#LI-UN1
The Perks
With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our
Careers
page.
Your Future
Marvell provides a work environment that promotes employee growth and development. We are searching for an individual who wants to grow with the company and will strive to improve performance. If you are driven, personable, and energetic, there will be additional opportunities for you here at Marvell.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

title: [EPS] Secretary Intern (6 months)
description:
Company Description

The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. It employs roughly 394,500 associates worldwide (as of December 31, 2020). According to preliminary figures, the company generated sales of 71.6 billion euros in 2020. Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.
The Bosch Group comprises Robert Bosch GmbH and its roughly 440 subsidiaries and regional companies in some 60 countries. If its sales and service partners are included, then Bosch is represented in roughly 126 locations. This worldwide development, manufacturing, and sales network is the foundation for further growth.
BGSV – Bosch Global Software Technologies Vietnam Company Limited (Previous name: RBVH - Robert Bosch Engineering and Business Solutions Vietnam Company Limited) is 100% owned subsidiary of Robert Bosch GmbH.

BGSV has started its operations from 19th October, 2010 at E-Town2 in HCMC. This engineering development center will be engaged in developing embedded systems and software, mechanical design and simulation, and will provide IT (SAP Consulting, JAVA Development….) and Business Services (Finance and accounting, Economics, Purchasing, Logistics, Translations Japanese-English-Japanese, Information Security ) solutions to the Bosch group of companies globally.

Job Description

1. Support for Department Secretary
Get to know and support for welcoming & exit processes (deal with HR department, PC arrangement with CI team, create User ID on Bosch system, communicate with new members…)
Add-in, modify and maintain Monthly Department Employee List and Department Organizational chart by Visio tool
Receive/send courier
Update department internal process/guidelines.
2. Support for Department accessories/infrastructure management activities
Support Department ITFM/PC inventory;
Manage and distribute department asset (PCs, mouse, keyboard, RAM, monitor) and take a record;
Support associates to change damaged/broken devices.
3. Support for Department activities

Participate in designing and create contents for Department Newsletter
Support to organize Department meetings, Workshops
Contribute ideas for Department events and be a part of organizing them Team outing, Associate engagement activities…
Take a role as communication supporter for Department events on social media platforms
4. Contribute ideas for Department events and be a part of organizing them: Quarterly Townhall, Team outing, Workshops, Associate engagement activities…
5. Take responsible for materials ordering (stationery, electronic devices…)

Qualifications
4th-year student at university, major in Journalism, Business Administration, Secretary, Hospitality or related fields
Can join internship for 6 months (full-time, from Monday to Friday)
Good English skills (Speaking and Writing)
Do Canva efficiently, have knowledge in other graphic design tools is an advantage
Good communication and interpersonal skill and teamwork
Familiar with Microsoft Office (Word, Power point, Excel…)
Honest, good at logical thinking, well-organized, hard-working and responsible person

Additional Information
Monthly Internship allowance + Meal & Parking allowance.
1 day of paid leave per month.
Good benefits of Trade Union activities, team building and department trip.
Opportunity to work in global projects of fast developing company and being a part of innovation team contributing initiative ideas to the hi-tech world.
Engage in our diverse training programs which surely help strengthen both your personal and professional skills.

title: Pre-sales Consultant
description:
We are looking for a motivated IT engineer to join our R&D team to research and present/demo various software and service products to our prospective customer in several vertical industries: Oil & Gas, Power Generating, Air Ports/Sea Ports. Candidates with excellent communication/presentation skill with strong business mind are best suit for the job. While depth technical knowledge in certain IT field is a plus, a person with breath IT knowledge will be more desirable. Strong knowledge and pre-sales experience on Enterprise software product such as ERP, CRM, EAM is a must. The successful candidates will be given 02-month extensive basic product training and 06 months on-job-training by experienced pre-sales consultant.
Responsibilities:
Research to gain deep knowledge of company’s products and offering (focus around EAM/CMMS software solution)
Build presentation/demonstration material (Power Point Slices, Demo Script, Demo environment)
Present/demonstrate company’s products and offering to prospective client.
Explore client’s business problem and consult/propose software solutions to address their needs
Follow-up with prospective customer during the Sales/Pre-sales process on technical aspects.
Draft and review various pre-sales documentation: RFx, Technical Solution, Proposal, Bid Document, Contract SOW.
Support Sales/Marketing team to develop new products and offering.
Skills:
Good IT/Software technical knowledge
Hands-on pre-sales experience with at least one major enterprise software solution (e.g. ERP, CRM, EAM, CMMS…) (1+ Year)
Strong document drafting and presentation/demonstration skills
Self-motivated, fast learner.
Ability to multi-task, and to work independently under minimum supervision.
Strong logical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent English communication skills
Education:
University degree in Information Technology or Business Administration or equivalent.
Candidates with Non-IT degree must be able to demonstrate strong IT technical knowledge to be qualified for the job.
HOW TO APPLY
Please submit your CVs and covering letter to us via email: career@avenue-net.com (Mr. Quang)

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

1. Conceptualize, design and produce artwork, illustrations and graphics for various collaterals - digital and print
2. Design collateral for offline channel e.g. red packets, banners, posters, flyers
3. Design collateral for online channel e.g social media posts, website banners, powerpoint decks, PR articles
4. Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to functionalities and features of digital media
Requirements
College/ University graduated
At least 2 years of design experience
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Lightroom) or other relevant software and technologies
Passionate about great design and crafting an engaging brand. Dedicated to deadlines and having excellent time-management to work on several projects simultaneously, efficiently and independently
Creative thinking, getting information, interacting, time management, influencing skills
Innovative, independent and can work under high pressure
Good at English
Working address: Ninja Van Vietnam Office, Tan Binh district, Ho Chi Minh city.

Salary and benefits:
Competitive income compared to the market
"Tet" bonus , Performance review from 1 - 4 months
Paid social insurance based on full salary
12 days annual leave, 5 days sick leave (with full salary)
High-class AON Health Insurance for manager level.
Year End Party, annual Townhall Ceremony
Annual company trip
Attractive team-building activities, regular internal activities
Provide laptop for employees

Training and developing:
Participate in internal training courses: online/offline
Opportunities to promote to higher positions: Senior, Team Leader, Manager etc.

Work environment & colleagues:
Senior leaders are open-minded, respectful and ready to facilitate personal growth
Young and dynamic working environment
Scope of work is large, the company has more than 6000 employees, the company has operations spreading to 63 provinces/cities throughout the country.

Submit a job application
By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

title: Logistics Leader
description:
Ecolab is seeking a Logistics Supervisor to be a self-directed achiever with the ability to wear many hats of operations management and lead a team of employees to improve safety, quality and productivity metrics. You will have the opportunity to lead various process improvement projects and participate with cross-functional teams on warehouse and network design initiatives.
What’s in it For You:
Opportunity for a long term career path that allows for exposure into all areas of the Ecolab’s supply chain
Access to best in class resources, tools, and technology
Thrive in a company that values sustainability, drives a safety-focused culture and has been recognized as one of the most ethical companies in the world
Comprehensive benefits packages in line with market and industry standards
What You Will Do:
Lead a team, holding them accountable to savings and productivity standards.
Oversee logistics activities including inventory control, warehousing, transportation, logistics planning, order processing and customer service.
Partner with cross-functional teams in Quality, Planning, Procurement and Manufacturing to proactively identify and resolve quality and service issues relating to logistics operations.
Assist in developing the site logistics budget with a focus on continuously improving year over year performance against metrics.
Coordinate operational redesign projects to improve performance and meet customer needs.
Monitor fixed assets and coordinate implementation of approved capital improvement projects in your functional areas.
Communicate standard logistics metrics to direct reports.
Resolves quality, service & cost issues.
Support oversight of inventory levels
Position Details:
Candidate must reside in: Ho Chi Minh City
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
Previous related work experience in a manufacturing, logistics, military or related environment
Previous supervisory experience
Immigration sponsorship not available for this role
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, Transportation, Business or a related field of study
Previous supervisory experience in a manufacturing, warehousing or military environment
Proficiency in SAP and Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Microsoft Excel and Access
Previous project management experience
Exposure to TPM and/or Lean Manufacturing principals
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to exercise independent judgement, think critically and work well in cross-functional teams
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.
In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

title: IT Project Coordinator
description:
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam, as well as branches and offices.
Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

Job Responsibilities
Communicating with stakeholders regarding project needs and goals.
Contributing to the planning and development of projects.
Contributing to the system design, technical troubleshooting of the project.
Contributing to the system requirement assessment and system test.
Supporting the coordination and management of projects.
Researching information as required.
Performing administrative tasks such as preparing invoices, estimates, scheduling meetings, etc.
Keeping track of and reporting on project progress.
Completing any tasks assigned by Line Manager in an efficient and timely manner.
Other tasks assigned.

Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in IT or relevant majors.
English proficiency.
At least 2 years as IT Project Executive or above in a large foreign financial institution.
Strong attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Excellent knowledge of Agile, Waterfall methodologies.

Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.
Apply now and make a difference.
We will review carefully your application and be in touch if your profile is shortlisted.

title: Java Developer Intern (IoT Project)
description:
Company Description

The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. In 2013, its roughly 281,000 associates generated sales of 46.4 billion Euros. Since the beginning of 2013, its operations have been divided into four business sectors: Automotive Technology, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. The Bosch Group comprises Robert Bosch GmbH and its roughly 360 subsidiaries and regional companies in some 50 countries. If its sales and service partners are included, then Bosch is represented in roughly 150 countries. This worldwide development, manufacturing, and sales network is the foundation for further growth.
BGSV - Bosch Global Software Technologies Vietnam Company Limited is 100% owned subsidiary of Robert Bosch GmbH. BGSV has started its operations from 19th October, 2010 at e-Town2 in HCMC. This engineering development center will be engaged in developing embedded systems and software, mechanical design and simulation, and will provide IT (SAP Consulting, JAVA Development….) and Business Services (Finance and accounting, Economics, Purchasing, Logistics, Translations Japanese-English-Japanese, Information Security ) solutions to the Bosch group of companies globally.

Job Description

The Bosch IoT Suite, the Bosch Group’s core software platform for IoT solutions, connects more than 10 million devices – vehicles, sensors in urban and agricultural applications or gateways in buildings. You will play a significant part in a joint collaboration to build up solutions, services for multiple different projects related to Manufacturing, connected Machine Applications or Building Technologies for both internal or external stakeholders under the high-end industry standards. To get to know our IoT platform, let's dive deeper in this page: bosch.com/stories/iot-platform-like-a-bosch/
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Understand the software requirement document and quality aspects
Perform requirement analysis, technical design and implement new customer requirements
Perform product testing, provide test documentation to ensure quality consistency
Understand and apply new technologies into project such as Microservice architecture, Cloud computing (Azure/AWS), CI/CD…
Understand and practice on global software development, product development standard process
Learn and get knowledge, experience from Expert/Senior members

Qualifications
Third or last-year students, majored in IT, Computer Science or equivalent.
Good knowledge in Java.
Good knowledge in HTML/ Javascript/ CSS. Have knowledge in Angular/ ReactJS is advantage.
Good English communication skills.
Can join full-time internship program for 6 months.

Additional Information

Why BOSCH?
Because we don't just follow trends, we create them.
Because together we turn ideas into reality, working every day to make the world of tomorrow a better place. Do you have high standards when it comes to your job? So do we. At Bosch, you will discover more than just work.
Benefits and Career Opportunities
Working in one of the Best Places to Work in Vietnam and Top 30 of the Most Innovative Companies all over the world
Join a dynamic and fast growing global company (English - speaking environment)
Monthly Internship allowance + Meal & Parking allowance
1 day of paid leave per month
Flexible working time
Fitness & sport activities: football, badminton, yoga, Aerobic
Free in-house entertainment facilities and snack
Good benefits of Trade Union activities, team building and company trip.
Engage in our diverse training programs which surely help strengthen both your personal and professional skills.

title: Partner Relations (Business Development)
description:
International award-winning executive recruitment expert Monroe Consulting Group is recruiting on behalf of an international technology and advertising company.
Our client is looking for a professional and experienced candidate with strong experience in banking, consumer loans and payment schemes. The job is based in Ho Chi Minh City.
Job Responsibilities:
Negotiate with new partners to expand business activities.
Accelerate business with existing partners to increase card issuance, spending volume and market share.
Develop and implement a plan to introduce new products and services to partners, build a better business environment.
Collect information about partners and markets, then recommend and take necessary actions, report to superiors and share information with internal teams.
Conduct research and interviews with partners requested by headquarters and internal teams, and share your insights.
Assist supervisor in other assigned duties.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor degree or above
Around 25 - 27 years old
Experienced working in a bank card center
Business knowledge of card payments (Especially in issuing business)
Knowledge of banking, consumer loans and payment schemes
Excellent communication skills in English and Vietnamese
Report appropriately to supervisor, and cooperate with relevant internal teams
Wide networking and relationship in banking and payment industry
Job Type: Full-time

title: Customer Experience Design Manger
description:
ROLE PURPOSE
The Customer Experience (CX) Design manager will be responsible to lead Customer Experience improvement initiatives by leveraging Customer-centricity strategies & using design thinking methodologies. He/she is responsible for leading cross-functional team to enhance the customer centricity mindset, and embrace that into every new way of working in the organization. This is a role focused on holistic, omni-channel experience design from concept to implementation. Success measures in this role will be based upon agreed Customer Satisfaction measurements.

JOB RESPONSIBILITY

Leverage the customer research data to create more distinct customer personas that to develop personalized customer experience strategies, as well as identify opportunities for continuous improvement, which augment the customer experience and cultivate customer loyalty.
Discover customer and business needs through contextual inquiries, generative and quantitative research, and identify solutions to meet those needs, and present findings that will inform improvements in the customer experience.
Use storytelling to share discoveries, influence others (Business partners) and create energy & effective communication/campaign around ideas or initiatives to enhance the customer centricity mindset in the organization through customer journeys, storyboards, ecosystem, social media, service designs and other materials.
Lead cross functional collaboration & engagement to develop conscious action/execution that are aware of customers' needs, surroundings, and problems. The applications give the customers a tailored experience that can be scaled to a wider audience.
Continuous developing the customer journey on the touchpoints and identify opportunities to proactively intervene for better customer experience.
Recommend optimizing the customer touchpoints so that customers perceive the brands more favourably and the HVB services distinguishes itself as customer centricity.
JOB REQUIREMENTS:
A broad-based commercial/sales background, with extensive knowledge gained from working in a number of roles in different functions
This role requires hands-on strategy formulation, sprint design and facilitation, journey and concept design, qualitative research, communication and partnering on implementation.
Experience in designing and conducting Customer Experience Immersions, designing holistic, omni-channel consumer and service delivery ecosystem designs.
Examples of having led customer experience/service improvement program.
Good understanding of technology – digital savvy person, easy to work with digital products
Skilled in Power BI, Excel and Power Point (Customer Gauge and Customer CRM systems would be additional benefit)
Ability to execute visual, information, interaction, and appealing designs, presentations
Experience in Internal Communication, Employee Engagement is a plus

title: Front-end Developers
description:
NIC’s Client
Job Description
– Will be a key member in an agile scrum team composed of a Product Owner, a Senior Interaction
– Designer and multiple top-notch developers
– Deliver jaw-dropping, award-worthy frontend experiences

Backbase moves fast so you need to be capable of getting in-depth knowledge on the product wishes and
the company within a short amount of time.

know how to clearly share your vision and ideas to developers, designers and business stakeholders.
Required skills
- University degree in Information Technology - Getting stuff done is more important than your years of experience; - Knowledge of Javascript (AngularJS / Angular), CSS (SASS) and HTML; prefer experience to work professionally with Bootstrap.

title: Head Of D&A (Data Analytics)
description:
Job Descriptions:
Data Architecture
Build the best practices and strategies for Data Architecture to fulfill needs of the business with emerging latest technologies and capabilities.
Proactively drive the effort of identifying Data & analytics opportunities to manage and provide solutions for complex data feeds with customers’ demands.
Evaluate various data architectures and utilize them to propose, develop data solutions to meet customers’ requirements.
Drive the implementation/delivery of data & analytics products and services to meet customers’ requirements.
Team Development
Build Competency of D&A Department (Technical/Consulting/Project Implementation Competency)

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Quantitative Analysis, Computer Science, Software Engineering or Information Technology

Good at Problem Solving/ Critical thinking
Can-do altitude

title: Building Infrastructure Engineering Manager
description:
Dreamplex is Vietnam’s leading workplace experience provider. We design and deliver people-centric work experiences that help companies attract, engage, and retain the best talent, and that help employees to have a Better Day at Work.
At Co-Working places, IT plays an important role in providing member’s experiences. We are not only providing a stable Internet and Infrastructure to meet the needs of Members but also, we would sell the IT Services in the future. This is why we’re now hiring a:
Building Infrastructure Engineering Manager
This role will be vital in our service delivery organization for both internal Dreamplex projects and Member customisation. Alongside the delivery of projects, the role will also work closely with other teams to develop a road map of capital upgrades required for all locations.
Key responsibilities include:
Deployment Delivery Implementations
Accountable for successful delivery of new site openings & expansions
Ensures correct strategies are followed and that requirements meet the latest technical specifications & design standards
Controls & maintains project budgets to reduce & eliminate over-spend
Continually strive for efficiencies across the organization
Ensure all team roles, responsibilities and expected timeframes are clear for processes & procedures
Develop new best practice processes for upcoming products or initiatives
Ensure team processes and documentations are maintained and seek opportunities to improve them
Accountable for effective hand-over to the Operating On-site team, ensuring all relevant hand-over documentation is provided and centrally accessible
Propose and negotiate with providers along with vetting and onboarding new consultants and integration contractors
Develop the technology roadmap based on business and technical requirements. Provide input concerning technology developments, updated standards, and CAPEX budgets into the investment plan for the technology roadmap.
Member Solutions
Accountable for the delivery of custom member technology related requests, complete with ensuring handover documentation is supplied and correct member fees are applied
Ensuring member change order requests are met and deliveries achieved
Driving to deliver technology services revenue and discovering new revenue streams
Identify fresh and relevant technologies to create new and exciting products, drive innovation and deliver experience to add value to the user experience.
Facilitate requirements gathering sessions with enterprise level members to discuss IT, AV, and Security requirements and offer sound technology solutions
Assist the Sales in the smooth running of pre-sales client calls and tours along with creating sales tools and client facing documentation outlining standard technology offerings
Coordinate and collaborate with team across disciplines to ensure delivery of projects, including schedule, budget, technical and installation oversight

Excellent organizational and leadership skills

title: Digital IC Design, Internship
description:
About Marvell
At Marvell, we believe that infrastructure powers progress. That execution is as essential as innovation. That better collaboration builds better technology. Trusted by the world’s leading technology companies for 25 years, we move, store, process and secure the world’s data with semiconductor solutions designed for our customers’ current needs and future ambitions. Through a process of deep collaboration and transparency, we’re ultimately changing the way tomorrow’s enterprise, cloud, automotive, and carrier architectures transform—for the better.

The data infrastructure that our customers build has never been more critical to our global economy. It’s what’s keeping the world connected, businesses running, and information flowing. If you’re ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy your work, apply now for the position detailed below.
The Opportunity
The Optics team builds highly integrated component platforms with high speed Silicon photonics, transmit and receive amplifiers, controller ASIC’s with Marvell DSP’s. These components are made operational with a highly functional embedded firmware. The team is responsible for design, verification, and validation of these integrated high speed optical components. The team performs system level testing under various operating conditions, and validates the performance of the hardware, firmware and control loops. An engineer in this team will be involved in a full product lifecycle and will carry new products from inception all the way to NPI.
Job Responsibilities:
efining Digital Design strategy for specific designs based on design specifications & standards
Defining design solutions and design Specification for specific designs
Develop designs using Verilog, System Verilog.
Work on ASIC design flows using synthesis, quality tools (DC, Spyglass, Concert, etc)
Work with Design Verification team to test the design including defining testcases, debugging issues
Requirements:
BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or or related fields, or the equivalent work experience that provides knowledge and exposure to theories, principles and concepts. Prefer: University Technologies, University of Science.
GPA: 7.5+, especially good in Math, Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
Proficient in MATLAB
Have basic knowledge of programing languages as C/C++, etc.
Have basic knowledge of HW design languages as Verilog/System-Verilog/VHDL, etc.
Have basic knowledge of Linux environment
Strong problem-solving skill
Excellent communication skill
Good in English skills
The Perks
With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our
Careers
page.
Your Future
Marvell provides a work environment that promotes employee growth and development. We are searching for an individual who wants to grow with the company and will strive to improve performance. If you are driven, personable, and energetic, there will be additional opportunities for you here at Marvell.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

This role will be working on reporting and analytics infrastructure needs for Ninja Van Vietnam. He/She will be working with
various departments to support the mounting data needs, especially the data infrastructure and architecture in Ninja Van
Vietnam.

Responsibilities:
Business Intelligence
Responsible for SQL and another relational database administrations and management (capacity planning,installation, backup, recovery, monitoring, optimizations, troubleshooting, etc)
Support development teams and production teams for database designs and implementations
Design and build tables, schema. Set up ETL or data pipelines to load data for end-users.
Review existing system architecture and contribute to improving on the future architecture for database stability and a maximum performance
Maintain and improve data integrity/quality
Create consumable data marts for BI analysts
Define and develop projects that reduce database operational costs and automate regular tasks
Research and develop new technologies and approaches for building highly available data persistence systems

Requirement
Experience: 1-2 years working as a data analytics professional.
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information System
Technical skills: SQL, Python, Spark, ETL tools
Familiarity with cloud data tools such as Airflow, Google Cloud Platform tools
Teamwork, data processing, data architecture

title: Head of Commercial
description:
About Intrepid

Intrepid Group (www.intrepid.asia), an Ascential company (https://www.ascential.com/), is a leading regional Digital and Ecommerce Services Provider in South East Asia. We offer end-to-end omni-channel ecommerce management, a wide range of Digital Marketing Services and advanced Insights & Analytics, all powered by state of the art inhouse Technology to our client base of leading international brands across >10 marketplaces and multiple social platforms in all 6 SEA countries. Brands love our regional presence, our excellent pro-active ecommerce service which is enabled by our strong team, and our advanced marketing and tech capabilities.

We are part of Ascential (https://www.ascential.com), a global leader in information, analytics and eCommerce optimization. Together with Ascential, Intrepid is growing rapidly, with many exciting opportunities to work with leading brands and ecommerce platforms across multiple categories. By joining us, you’ll get to experience what it takes to drive a successful ecommerce business end to end.

The role:
As Head of Commercial, you will report directly to the Country CEO. You will be responsible for building and hitting the revenue plan at category, platform and brand level and overseeing the management of relationships with our clients. You will manage and coach a team of enthusiastic key account managers and support them in interactions with senior brand executives. You will develop and implement processes to scale our operations while ensuring we enable our clients to reach their ecommerce potential.
*E-commerce experience is required*

Responsibilities:
As the Head of Commercial Key account management, you will be responsible for the following:

Ensure that all brand and store KPIs are met on time.
Analyze sales performance and advise clients on how to grow their ecommerce sales in a sustainable way. Drive sales through stock availability, pricing competitiveness, effective merchandising and targeted assortment growth.
Grow revenue and profitability for Intrepid by partnering with Business Development on offering new value adding services to clients, optimizing commercial terms with existing clients and scaling existing operational processes.
Maintain close relationships with both brands and ecommerce platforms. Interact daily with partners to ensure timely and effective implementation of strategy.
Coach and develop your team members.

Who we look for – the ideal profile:

University degree
Proficiency in English
Minimum 5-6 years of relevant work experience in ecommerce, ideally with a platform (Lazada /Shopee), with another enabler, or with a brand or distributor. You have a strong network with ecommerce platforms in Vietnam.
Commercial experience - you understand customer needs and drivers of performance. You leverage your expertise to advise brands on all ecommerce topics. Your strong interpersonal skills including presentation and listening skills allow you to build trust and lasting senior client relationships.
You know how to reconcile top down and bottom-up targets. You are data driven and your excellent analytical skills are backed by proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
Managerial experience- you have years of experience in a leadership position. You have managed a team before.
You have a result-oriented mindset and a track record driving impact in a fast-paced start-up environment. You take ownership. You are nimble and excel at cross-functional collaboration.

What we offer:
Competitive salary package, performance-based
Key external facing position in a fast-growing international ecommerce company that has strong momentum and strong competitive differentiators (team, technology, regional footprint), this role offers an exciting growth journey and opportunity to co-create our success story.
You will work with leading brands across different categories to shape their presence across all ecommerce platforms in the years to come and will have a broad view on the latest developments in the South East Asian ecommerce ecosystem.
Ample opportunity for personal and professional development, both on the job and through regular training (Ecommerce topics, soft skill and leadership training).
Annual leave for all Vietnamese holidays recognized by Vietnamese labor law and standardised 12 days personal annual leave.

About Intrepid Vietnam:
https://www.intrepid.asia/

Office location: FL 09, Central Park Tower, 208 Nguyen Trai, Pham Ngu Lao W., D1, HCMC.

title: Senior Technical Officer
description:
Overview:
RMIT UNIVERSITY VIETNAM
RMIT University Vietnam
, an entity of RMIT University, has campuses in Ho Chi Minh City and Hanoi since 2001. We provide internationally recognised, high-quality, education and professional training for students, clients, and the community, and assist in the development of human resources capability in Vietnam and the region by hosting students from Australia and many other countries.
SCHOOL OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY
The School of Science, Engineering & Technology at RMIT Vietnam is associated with the STEM College of RMIT University Melbourne, delivering the College’s award programs and developing research in the field(s) of science, engineering and health. Programs currently taught on the Vietnam campus include the Bachelor of Information Technology, Bachelor of Engineering (Electrical and Electronics), Bachelor of Engineering (Software Engineering), Bachelor of Engineering (Robotics & Mechatronics), Bachelor of Applied Science (Aviation), Bachelor of Applied Science (Psychology), and the Doctor of Philosophy (Engineering) (Electrical and Electronic Engineering).
YOUR ROLE
This position is responsible for programming and operating the machines in the Advanced Manufacturing Workshop (AMW). He will ensure that the AMW and other SST labs are well maintained and organized so that students have access to equipment which is in good working order to complete projects in compliance with laboratory rules and guidelines and that staff are supported in the setting up of equipment for laboratory sessions.
The Senior Technical Officer is responsible for programming and operating the machines in the Advanced Manufacturing Workshop (AMW). The role will ensure that the AMW and all SST labs are well-maintained and well-organized in a good working condition for students and for demonstration by academic staff during their lab activities. This position also provides high-level technical support to staff and students in the safe operation and use of our equipment and facilities.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Fabricate the student’s design project using the advanced machines including the put the full name of CNC here (CNC), laser cutter, 3D printer and PCB…) in the AMW workshop.
Deliver workshops for students using the AMW.
Deliver Occupational Health & Safety (OHS) training for new students; review and approve student's risk assessment form before performing any lab activities.
Provide high-level technical support and advice to staff and students in development, operation and safe use of engineering equipment.
Maintain laboratories and laboratory equipment in a ready, serviceable, clean and safe condition to aid the Schools educational activities, including organizing preventive maintenance service, troubleshooting and repairs where required.
Provide regular reports and propose solutions to the Manager, Planning & Operations and SPMs regarding equipment that needs to be repaired or replaced, inventory, and process issues.
Provide expert advice for procurement of new equipment, hardware/software tools and materials/components, as well as setting up of equipment/tools service contracts.
Staying updated with the latest developments in relevant technologies and OHS guidelines.
Lead initiatives related to SSET labs and teaching facilities.
Other technical duties as determined by line manager and SPMs.
KEY SELECTION CRITERIA
Bachelor degree relevant to engineering and/or science.
Experienced in running an engineering or academic department laboratory.
Experienced in running CNC machine (knowledgeable on CAD/CAM).
Good general technical knowledge and practical skills - soldering, basic electronic circuit design.
Assemble/solder low powered leads for laboratory equipment.
Demonstrated knowledge of current Occupational Health & Safety legislation, regulations and practices as well as relevant experience in their implementation.
Demonstrated ability to contribute to and work as part of a collaborative team committed to creating and managing signature partnerships that enhance the University’s strategic development goals.
Demonstrated ability to quickly establish productive, collaborative relationships with people at all levels, both internal and external to the university.
Well-developed interpersonal skills, including cross cultural communication and business writing skills.
Ability to multi-task with forward planning capability and meticulous attention to detail.
Demonstrated ability to service clients and provide client-centred solutions.
Ability to work under pressure and unfailingly meet deadlines.
CULTURE
Our people make everything at the University possible. We encourage new approaches to work and learning, stimulating change to drive positive impact. RMIT exists to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work. You will be a part of a productive and collaborative team, who values working relationships and outcomes through open and inclusive planning, continuous information sharing and transparent work practices
TO FIND OUT MORE
For further information about this role, please click on the Job Description document
here
.
BENEFITS
Work for the leading international University in Vietnam.
Competitive remuneration in VND plus benefits
Private premium medical insurance for employee and immediate dependents
13th month bonus
20 days annual leave plus 5 days paid leave Xmas closure, plus public holidays and paid sick leave.
Great career development opportunity; both personal and professional.
Onsite gym and range if exercise classes and activities
Ongoing professional development program and support.
Applications Close:
30 thg 1 2023 11.59 pm
RMIT University Vietnam (RMIT Vietnam) is a campus of RMIT University. RMIT Vietnam is creating an innovative research, teaching and learning culture. We are committed to providing internationally recognised high-quality education and professional training for our students, clients and members of the community. As an internationally recognised Australian university based in Asia, RMIT Vietnam is assisting in the development of human resources capability in Vietnam and the region.
https://www.rmit.edu.vn/about-us

title: IT Recruitment Consultant
description:
Job Description

Permanent Contract, Full time
Location: WeWork Lim Tower 3, Dist 1, HCMC
Reports to: Team Leader
Working Hours: 9AM - 6PM, Mon - Fri
Job Summary
We are looking for a competent Recruitment Consultant to assist our Clients in finding the best people to staff their business. Do you want to be in a young and dynamic working environment where you can do your best in your career and live the best you are? A transparent, collaborative working vibes with monthly party & fun activities can mood you up? Let’s join team to strive for the best, and together we make “Right People – Right Team”.
About Us
Established in 2006 in Singapore – and now a part of the $3 bn TechnoPro Group, Japan – Helius has partnered and supported leading companies across diverse industries to deliver large scale staffing, recruiting services programs and dedicated secure offices that house technology teams, Helius’ strength also lies in its understanding of cultural and language-specific landscapes in the ASEAN region.
Helius Vietnam is a full-service, IT recruitment firm providing headhunting for permanent roles and contract staffing services. We are trusted by many organizations and our blue-chip clients, our reputation and expertise are built from our years of market experience and countless success stories with our clients.
Duties and Reponsibilities
Search and Client Management
Be responsible for delivering high quality service to clients and candidates.
Promote and build awareness of Helius’ Executive Search capabilities to an existing client database.
Work with client companies, find out about their business, their culture, their current and future recruitment needs, and to develop a loyal and powerful relationship with them.
Attract candidates by well preparing job description, job posting, screening and short listing applicants; as well as by networking, headhunting and through referrals.
Screen and interview candidates in accordance with company standards
Organize interviews for candidate as requested by the client;
Ensure the recruitment speed and results of the assigned vacancies are efficient with regards to turn around time and candidate’s quality
Provide advice to both clients and candidates on salary, training and career progression.
Follow up on leads for permanent recruitment provided by other staff members
Review recruitment policies to ensure effectiveness of selection techniques and recruitment programs
Perform other tasks assigned by manager/director
2. Business Development Strategies
Actively market Helius’ Executive Search capabilities to clients and candidates
Assist with division / company business development needs
Collect/relay market information to superior maximizing business opportunities
Cooperate with other managers/Consultants to meet corporate target
Requirements
At least 1-3 years of experience in a Recruitment Agency environment
IT Recruitment background is preferred
Experience in Business Development is a plus.
Hungry, humble, open-minded, ambitious and engaging.
Good at English
Our Benefits
Competitive and attractive salary, bonus and benefits regime, as well as insurance as per regulated by law
Opportunity to work in one of the best working spaces in HCMC, with a young, talented & dynamic team
Premium healthcare offered for employees after passing the probation
14 pro-rated annual leave, 10 annual sick leave as well as flexible working time
Monthly party and fun activities
Company trip (Domestic & International), team building and many interesting activities for bonding and development team

title: Lodging Service Associate - Vietnamese Language Support (Based in Kuala Lumpur)
description:

Lodging Service Associate (Vietnamese Speaker)

In this position, you will focus on supporting the onboarding process of new hotel partners on our platform, and on maintaining property content on our branded websites by resolving requests submitted by partners and internal teams, providing inbound and outbound support to our partners. You will be versatile in handling multiple software programs, prompt and accurate in your responses in email and phone communications providing a clear, rapid, competent support experience.
Using dedication and compassion when dealing with our partners, you will work closely with other departments to ensure the best resolution at first contact will be given to them.

Who you are:
Proficiency in English and Vietnamese
University Degree; or equivalent related professional experience
Experience in customer service-oriented industry
Hotel/Travel industry experience will be a plus
Fluency with internet, computer usage, and web-based application skills
Experience with Microsoft Office products and various call center support programs
Strong ability to adapt to changes, learn new processes and systems quickly
Operates autonomously with a positive demeanor and a strong work ethic
Problem-solving and solutions mentality with a passion in providing the best partner and traveler experience
Ability to handle difficult situations successfully; set expectations and deliver feedback in a positive way
Ability to identify complexities and maintain ownership of processes and resolve issues
Excellent time-management and prioritization skills
Listens carefully and attentively to others’ opinions and ideas
Being able to understand others' perspectives and clarify meaning before responding
A keen eye for detail and high-level of accuracy
Exercise good judgment in decision-making
About Expedia Group
Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.

title: Chief Of Staff
description:
“Unifying Purpose, Shaping Careers”. We believe in a world where organizational strategies are brought to life; when everyone finds value in their work by aligning organizational purpose with people, where we inspire a meaningful and impactful future.

Hatch Asia is working in partnership with a global investment group that operates across multiple industries. As the company looks to invest resources into multiple technology plays, the organization is looking to identify a Chief of Staff for a portfolio company that is focused on loyalty solutions.

The Chief of Staff will play the role of a confidant to the CEO and will be focused on helping to problem solve and execute on key decisions for the organization. As Chief of Staff, you will partner with the CEO in driving the company forward by leading and overseeing key metrics and processes, and working closely with the executive leadership team.

The Challenges

Manage key priorities and play the role of a true business partner/advisor to the CEO.
Be the main liaison between the CEO and the executive leadership team in order to collect and analyze information from the various functions to evaluate, prioritize and successfully execute on strategic initiatives.
Oversee daily business operations and strategic planning through collaboration with senior management and department leaders and being comfortable in performing a wide array of tasks.
Build strong relationships with all employees to improve communication and coordination across departments to achieve the organization’s objectives.
Oversee and project manage strategic initiatives such as fundraising and any potential M&A deals the company may intend to pursue.
Improve current processes and optimize organizational procedures for efficiency and productivity.
play the role of the subject-matter expert, handling critical inquiries, developing action plans and assisting with preparation and dissemination of communications.
What It Takes

Degree in Business/Economics with time spent in a top-tier strategy consulting firm will be extremely valuable.
strong grasp of financials and experience within Technology companies will be an added advantage.
Experience leading complex initiatives and working with senior leadership teams.
Global program management and exposure to leading multiple complex projects will be critical
All information will be kept in the strictest confidentiality.
Priority responses will be given to candidates who are shortlisted.
Employment Agency No: 11C5794

title: Senior Content Copywriter
description:
Overview:
About RMIT Vietnam
RMIT is a global university of technology, design, and enterprise. We are global in footprint and even more importantly, we are global in mindset. We are committed to making a positive impact wherever we go. The wider our reach, the deeper our connections, the greater our impact.
RMIT University Vietnam (RMIT Vietnam) is a campus of RMIT University with 700 staff and 7,000 students, in three locations, and recently awarded one of the Best Companies to work for in Asia 2020. From a media perspective RMIT Vietnam enjoys a 40% share of voice in the sector. It brings a world-class education and globalised study environment to the heart of Asia, offering programs in business, technology, communication, design, fashion, and English language. It boasts an impressive range of extra-curricular activities that encourage students to innovate and network globally.
Degrees are awarded by RMIT in Australia and taught in English, enabling Vietnamese students (and visiting international students) the opportunity to receive an international education without having to leave home.
The Role
The Senior Content copywriter supports the development of content marketing for different platforms including but not limited to ad copies, PR articles, social media content, newsletters, and school brochures. The role will work with different internal stakeholders, gathering/collecting information from them to generate engaging and relevant content to build the story that our audiences will connect with.
Your Responsibilities
In charge of content writing for social media platforms for different groups of audiences: parents, under-graduate students, post-graduate students, alumni, etc. This scope will require him/her to work closely with Digital team. Preferred candidate is encouraged to have insights about parent group and post-graduate study.
Take lead for developing PR plan for specific projects, campaigns and develop the PR articles in that plan accordingly.
Develop short-form copy for print ads or digital ads, and long-form copy for other marketing materials such publication/brochures, newsletter, landing page content, web content…
Work with KOLs or influencers, student ambassadors, alumni for generating relevant & high engagement content.
Research, understand and respond to digital trends, audience segments and their behaviour and motivations to come up with ideas, initiatives for content marketing.
Overlook the distribution of content through the university’s established online channels and traditional platforms that Marketing owns; making sure contents across touchpoints aligned with RMIT’s key communication messages & content guideline.
Build relationships with internal and external stakeholders including academic staffs, students, press, publishers, key opinion leaders, influencers etc., to curate and deliver relevant content.
Work with & supervise part-time content contributors in content execution for different online channels.
Has knowledge of SEO.
Skills and Experience
A degree in a discipline relevant to this position such as marketing, communications, public relations, journalism.
At least two years of relevant experience in content planning and content development for multi-digital platforms, especially social media. Experience in working with social influencers is a plus.
Ability to effectively communicate with different stakeholders
Ability to effectively prioritize and deliver against multiple deadlines
Culture
Our people make everything at the University possible. We encourage new approaches to work and learning, stimulating change to drive positive impact. RMIT exists to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work. You will be a part of a productive and collaborative team, who values working relationships and outcomes through open and inclusive planning, continuous information sharing and transparent work practices.
Benefits
Competitive gross salary.
13th month bonus + private medical insurance (for you and your dependents) + annual health check.
20 days annual leave plus 5 days paid leave Christmas closure, plus public holidays and paid sick leave.
Unique opportunity to work within a multi-lingual, multi-cultural environment with creative and innovative committed colleagues.
Free use of onsite gym
Library on campus and online - access to RMIT Australia online library
To Apply
Please submit your CV and cover letter outlining your experience by clicking on the ‘Apply now’ link.
Applications Close:
15 thg 1 2023 11.59 pm
RMIT University Vietnam (RMIT Vietnam) is a campus of RMIT University. RMIT Vietnam is creating an innovative research, teaching and learning culture. We are committed to providing internationally recognised high-quality education and professional training for our students, clients and members of the community. As an internationally recognised Australian university based in Asia, RMIT Vietnam is assisting in the development of human resources capability in Vietnam and the region.
https://www.rmit.edu.vn/about-us

ADVANTAGEOUS:

– Knowledge in other languages such as Russian, Spanish, Vietnamese or Chinese is a plus

title: Information Security Incident Response and Forensics Analyst
description:
The Role
Incident Response and Forensic Analyst to lead the development and operation of a forensics and malware analysis functional capability in support of ongoing investigative and incident response activities.

The successful candidate for this job will have a proven record of identifying and tracking cyber threats, and a technical understanding of the tools, techniques, and procedures used by threat actors. The candidate will dissect exploits, attacker tools and implants in support of incident responders, and will also help develop innovative tools to assist responders and automate malware analysis and reverse engineering efforts.

The Incident Response and Forensic Analyst is expected to work with minimal guidance against a broad set of objects to handle a variety of complex assignments and situations. Within established priorities and deadlines, the successful candidate will exercise independent judgment in selecting and applying appropriate methods, procedures, techniques, and practices.
What the Infosec Team wants you to know
Infosec work at Ampere is interesting, challenging, and will expand your professional breadth. We are currently a small team that is passionate about information security and protecting the company’s intellectual property.
What you’ll do
Reverse engineer malware in support of incident response and threat intelligence requirements
Research and develop methods of tracking and detecting malicious activity within an enterprise network
Use various tools and techniques to analyze malicious document files, executables and web-based malware
Conducts analysis of cybercriminal entities' use of technology to target, collect, and exploit customer information and information systems, personnel, and operations and participate in security education programs and briefings
Performs open-source research to enable and facilitate the identification of cybercriminal activity
Utilizes understanding of attack signatures, tactics, techniques and procedures associated with advanced threats
Delivers reports, briefings, and assessments to customers and leadership, facilitating understanding of cyber threat entities and environments
Prepares and presents briefings as subject matter expert as required
What you’ll bring
Strong understanding of malware analysis and incident response framework
Able to conduct code and behavioral analysis of malware, including building a lab environment and is capable of using but not limited to debuggers, disassemblers, sniffers, and other analysis toolsets
Proficiency with network traffic analysis
Experience with using memory forensics techniques to analyze malware threats
Experience identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in data sets
Knowledge of packers and obfuscation techniques as well as experience defeating anti-analysis techniques
Familiarity with the use of forensics images and memory dumps in support of incident response
Ability to recognize and handle sensitive data appropriately
Strong leadership skills with the ability to prioritize and execute in a methodical and disciplined manner
Demonstrated ability to manage customer relationships
Possess a strong working knowledge of all Microsoft applications (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access)
Able to communicate effectively orally and in writing to include investigative reports
Must be on call after work hours for any incident response emergency
Involvement with process development and deployment
Knowledge in information technologies to include computer hardware and software, operating systems, and networking protocols
Experience performing network traffic analysis
Experience using Splunk and or ELK Stack for analysis
Experience with using scripting languages to include but not limited to PowerShell, BASH, and Python
Education
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience with at least 3-5 years of experience in vulnerability management and Ansible playbook development.
Our Company
Ampere is designing the future of hyperscale cloud and edge computing with the world’s first cloud native processor. Built for the cloud with a modern 64-bit Arm server-based architecture, Ampere gives customers the freedom to accelerate the delivery of all cloud computing applications. With industry-leading cloud performance, power efficiency and scalability, Ampere processors are tailored for the continued growth of cloud and edge computing.
Our Story
Like the scientist behind its name, Ampere employees are innovators. We understand the needs of cloud computing and different software requirements. We are inventing what comes next and looking at everything from the structure of memory and how efficient the system is, to considerations on speed, cost of electricity and ability to cool. Power, size, weight and cost are driving the technology requirements and the innovation to come.
Our world class team of engineers, with depth and expertise in the cloud and semiconductor industries, is not only focused on the development of new semiconductor designs but also building out the first software ecosystem for Arm®-based server processors. Through the Ampere approach to the cloud and edge, we give our customers the freedom to challenge the status quo and accelerate next-generation data centers for the most memory-intensive applications. Given the challenge we have outlined, we are building a culture of entrepreneurs that ensure customers come first, proactively approaching industry challenges in the areas of security, power and performance, delivering results that matter most.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
About Intrepid

Intrepid Group (www.intrepid.asia), an Ascential company (https://www.ascential.com/) is a leading regional Digital and Ecommerce Services Provider in South East Asia. We offer end-to-end omni-channel ecommerce management, a wide range of Digital Marketing Services and advanced Insights & Analytics, all powered by state of the art inhouse Technology to our client base of leading international brands across >10 marketplaces and multiple social platforms in all 6 SEA countries. Brands love our regional presence, our excellent pro-active ecommerce service which is enabled by our strong team, and our advanced marketing and tech capabilities.

We are supported by Ascential, a global leader in information, analytics and eCommerce optimization. Together with Ascential, Intrepid is growing rapidly, with many exciting opportunities to work with leading brands and ecommerce platforms across multiple categories. By joining us, you’ll get to experience what it takes to drive a successful ecommerce business end to end.

The Role

Intrepid is currently looking for a Graphic Designer to be part of our Design team to create industry-leading marketing materials and content for brands across e-commerce platforms.

As a Graphic Designer, you will be responsible for the creation of all visual marketing and eCommerce assets; from online official store designs, product content, marketing campaigns & banners to store feed posts and live streams. These designs are of crucial importance as they are our online business card and for brands, the main interaction with online shoppers, having a direct impact on conversion rates & online sales.

You are driven, results-focused, and detail-oriented. You are creative and passionate about creating great designs with a real commercial impact. You can work independently and have excellent time management skills. You thrive in an open and collaborative environment and can work with demanding timelines.

Your Responsibilities will include:

Designed official stores, product page templates, campaign pages, promotions, and campaign banners on Lazada, Shopee, Tiki, Sendo, etc.
Design Store-feed posts, Facebook ads, Thumbnails, etc.
Work closely with Senior Designers and Design team management
Liaise with the KAM team on content & campaign requirements
Provide collaborative feedback on team member's designs and develop best practices
Structure & maintain your work in our content repository (asset library)
Accountable for on-time & on-quality delivery of content

Who we look for – the ideal profile:
Design education
Fresh or one year of experience as a graphic designer
Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop / Adobe Illustrator is a must
Proficiency in Adobe After Effects or HTML formatting is a plus
Good command of English
Strong problem-solving skills, willingness to learn, and drive to optimize
Keen to develop ideas independently and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment
Ecommerce experience is a plus

What do we offer
Excellent and competitive compensation package
Professional and open international working environment – culturally integrating the best of all cultures to take the best of each and ensure we build an energetic, commercial, and fun working atmosphere.
You are one of the pioneers of a new and cutting-edge Intrepid product underpinned by strong tech. You have a key position in the Intrepid Insights team working on a unique product solving complex data.
Ample opportunities for personal and professional development, both on the job and through regular training (Ecommerce topics, technical skills, soft skills, and leadership training) made available on our proprietary learning platform Intrepid University
You will work with many brilliant co-workers who are movers and shakers of the industry, as well as with leading brand and ecosystem partners across all categories to shape their presence across all eCommerce platforms in the years to come, and will have a broad view of the latest developments in the South East Asian e-commerce ecosystem

title: Logistics - Network Design Expert (Transportation)
description:
Company Description

The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, in the areas of automotive and industrial technology, consumer goods as well as building technology.
The Bosch Group comprises Robert Bosch GmbH and its roughly 440 subsidiaries and regional companies in over 60 countries with over 375,000 associates all over the world.
In Vietnam, Bosch is currently active with eight business divisions: Automotive Aftermarket, Drive and Control Technology, Power Tools, Building Technology, Thermo technology, Packaging Technology, Two-Wheeler and Powersports and Sales Original Equipment.
Furthermore Bosch opened its first Software and Engineering Centre of Southeast Asia in Ho Chi Minh City and an Automotive R&D Centre, located in Ho Chi Minh City in July 2014.
For further information, please visit our website: www.bosch.com.vn

Job Description

Network design and tender
Collect historical shipment data from all plants and legal entities in ASEAN, clarify the data and do proper data processing to make it usable for network design purposes
Work with internal customers to clarify the volume forecast, and work with purchasing to incorporate that into air and sea freight tender
Propose optimized routing or transport mode based on historical volume and customer requirement clarification, for example, LCL/LCL/LCLàLCL/FCL/FCL, airàsea, airàtruck, seaàtruck, airàmulti-modal etc..
Convince stakeholders in the region and get their consensus in the proposal by showing cost saving, CO2 reduction, or lead time reduction, etc..
Work together with LSP manager on volume allocation among awarded LSPs, and make sure internal customers follow the network design proposal during on-boarding of LSPs
Network optimization
Review network design on a regular basis and propose new route/transport mode to purchasing and internal customers by building up business case
Convince stakeholders in the region and get their consensus in the proposal
Work with LSP manager, purchasing and internal customers to realize the network design optimization
Consultancy
Contact point for any inquiries from internal customers in the region on new route or new transport mode
Able to propose alternative network/routing depending on the resource availability in the market and incorporate into regional network design roadmap
Data management
Find a way to collect as accurate and detailed data from internal stakeholders that are need for network design purposes
Build up some master data for the region, for example, incoterms, supplier list, customer list, product characteristics, etc., as a database to support any network design analysis
Continuously updating the shipment data for the region in a digitized manner
Representative of ASEAN region in global team
Collaborate with network design experts in other region to seek for optimization of network on a bigger scale, for example, EU-ASEAN, EMEA-APAC
Roll out good practice from ASEAN to other regions, and vice versa

Qualifications
Bachelor/Master Degree in Supply Chain or Logistics Engineering or data science related subjects
3 years+ in international transport, preferably with network design experience
3 years+ in project management, facing customers
Ability to work with non-perfect data, and good analytic skills, can identify opportunities from a massive amount of raw data
Digitization skills for example dashboard, is a plus
Initiative, excellent communication skills in English, and confident
Responsible, professional, careful and high service orientation

Additional Information
Committed 13th month bonus
Collaboratively yearly performance bonus
Meal & Parking allowances
Premium insurance for employee and 2 family members
Interesting Sport program
Domestic and international training opportunity
Career development program with buddy and mentoring program
Good benefits of company activities, team building and year end party
Opportunity to work in global projects of fast developing company and being a part of innovation team contributing initiative ideas to the digital transformation era

title: Production Coordinator (Night Shift Delivery)
description:
Location
Vietnam, Ho Chi Minh City - Sparx*
Department
Production & Planning
PLAY, GROW and WIN
To be a part of Virtuos means to be a creator and aim at excellence.
At Virtuos, we harness the latest technologies to make video games better and more immersive than ever before. That is why we pride ourselves in constantly pushing the boundaries of possibility since our founding in 2004.
Virtuosi are a team of experts – people who have come together to share their mutual passion for producing high-quality games. People who share the same enthusiasm in exploring new ideas and the constant drive to excel in their field. People who believe in earning success through dedication.
As a group, Virtuos has become a recognized leader in its field, has been growing faster than its peers have in recent years, and is pursuing an aggressive global expansion strategy. To this end, we are seeking an experienced Production Coordinator (Night Shift Delivery) who can join our team and help pave the way towards our new goals.

Sparx* is seeking a Production Coordinator who manages studio’s daily project deliveries to client and liaising with Producers for information.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
